verses.kjv: And when David was a little past the top of the hill, behold, Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth met him, with a couple of asses saddled, and upon them two hundred loaves of bread, and an hundred bunches of raisins, and an hundred of summer fruits, and a bottle of wine.
verses.ct: When David had gone just past the summit, Ziba, the servant of Mephibosheth, was there to meet him with 2 saddled donkeys loaded with 200 loaves of bread, 100 clusters of raisins, 100 cakes of summer fruit, and a skin of wine.

verses.kjv: And the king said unto Ziba, What meanest thou by these? And Ziba said, The asses be for the king’s household to ride on; and the bread and summer fruit for the young men to eat; and the wine, that such as be faint in the wilderness may drink.
verses.ct: The king asked Ziba, "What is all this for?" Ziba answered, "The donkeys are for the king's family to ride. The bread and summer fruit are for the young men to eat, and the wine is for anyone who becomes exhausted in the wilderness to drink."

verses.kjv: And the king said, And where is thy master’s son? And Ziba said unto the king, Behold, he abideth at Jerusalem: for he said, To day shall the house of Israel restore me the kingdom of my father.
verses.ct: The king asked, "And where is your master's grandson?" Ziba told the king, "He stayed behind in Jerusalem, because he said, 'Today the people of Israel will give me back my grandfather's kingdom.'"

verses.kjv: Then said the king to Ziba, Behold, thine are all that pertained unto Mephibosheth. And Ziba said, I humbly beseech thee that I may find grace in thy sight, my lord, O king.
verses.ct: The king said to Ziba, "Everything that belonged to Mephibosheth is now yours." Ziba replied, "I bow before you. May I continue to earn your trust, my lord the king."

verses.kjv: And when king David came to Bahurim, behold, thence came out a man of the family of the house of Saul, whose name was Shimei, the son of Gera: he came forth, and cursed still as he came.
verses.ct: When King David reached Bahurim, a man from Saul's family came out from there. His name was Shimei son of Gera, and he came out hurling curses as he approached.

verses.kjv: And he cast stones at David, and at all the servants of king David: and all the people and all the mighty men were on his right hand and on his left.
verses.ct: He threw stones at David and at all of King David's officials, even though all the soldiers and warriors surrounded David on every side.

verses.kjv: And thus said Shimei when he cursed, Come out, come out, thou bloody man, and thou man of Belial:
verses.ct: This is what Shimei shouted as he cursed: "Get out, get out, you murderer! You worthless man!"

verses.kjv: The LORD hath returned upon thee all the blood of the house of Saul, in whose stead thou hast reigned; and the LORD hath delivered the kingdom into the hand of Absalom thy son: and, behold, thou art taken in thy mischief, because thou art a bloody man.
verses.ct: "The LORD has paid you back for all the blood you shed from Saul's family, whose throne you stole! The LORD has handed the kingdom over to your son Absalom. Now you're caught in your own disaster, because you are a murderer!"

verses.kjv: Then said Abishai the son of Zeruiah unto the king, Why should this dead dog curse my lord the king? let me go over, I pray thee, and take off his head.
verses.ct: Abishai son of Zeruiah said to the king, "Why should this dead dog curse my lord the king? Let me go over there and cut off his head."

verses.kjv: And the king said, What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah? so let him curse, because the LORD hath said unto him, Curse David. Who shall then say, Wherefore hast thou done so?
verses.ct: But the king replied, "This is not your concern, sons of Zeruiah. Let him curse, because the LORD has told him to curse David. Who has the right to ask him why he's doing it?"

verses.kjv: And David said to Abishai, and to all his servants, Behold, my son, which came forth of my bowels, seeketh my life: how much more now may this Benjamite do it? let him alone, and let him curse; for the LORD hath bidden him.
verses.ct: David said to Abishai and to all his officials, "Look — my own son, my own flesh and blood, is trying to kill me. How much more reason does this Benjaminite have? Leave him alone and let him curse, because the LORD has instructed him to do it."

verses.kjv: It may be that the LORD will look on mine affliction, and that the LORD will requite me good for his cursing this day.
verses.ct: "Maybe the LORD will see my suffering and repay me with something good in return for the cursing I'm receiving today."

verses.kjv: And as David and his men went by the way, Shimei went along on the hill’s side over against him, and cursed as he went, and threw stones at him, and cast dust.
verses.ct: So David and his men continued along the road while Shimei walked along the hillside parallel to them, cursing as he went, throwing stones at him and kicking up dust.

verses.kjv: And the king, and all the people that were with him, came weary, and refreshed themselves there.
verses.ct: The king and everyone with him arrived exhausted, and they rested there to regain their strength.

verses.kjv: And Absalom, and all the people the men of Israel, came to Jerusalem, and Ahithophel with him.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Absalom and all the men of Israel arrived in Jerusalem, and Ahithophel was with him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Hushai the Archite, David’s friend, was come unto Absalom, that Hushai said unto Absalom, God save the king, God save the king.
verses.ct: When Hushai the Archite, David's friend, came to Absalom, Hushai said to Absalom, "Long live the king! Long live the king!"

verses.kjv: And Absalom said to Hushai, Is this thy kindness to thy friend? why wentest thou not with thy friend?
verses.ct: Absalom asked Hushai, "Is this how you show loyalty to your friend? Why didn't you go with your friend?"

verses.kjv: And Hushai said unto Absalom, Nay; but whom the LORD, and this people, and all the men of Israel, choose, his will I be, and with him will I abide.
verses.ct: Hushai answered Absalom, "No — I belong to whoever the LORD, this nation, and all the men of Israel have chosen. I will stay with him."

verses.kjv: And again, whom should I serve? should I not serve in the presence of his son? as I have served in thy father’s presence, so will I be in thy presence.
verses.ct: "Besides, who should I serve? Shouldn't I serve his son? Just as I served in your father's presence, I will serve in yours."

verses.kjv: Then said Absalom to Ahithophel, Give counsel among you what we shall do.
verses.ct: Then Absalom said to Ahithophel, "Give us your advice — what should we do?"

verses.kjv: And Ahithophel said unto Absalom, Go in unto thy father’s concubines, which he hath left to keep the house; and all Israel shall hear that thou art abhorred of thy father: then shall the hands of all that are with thee be strong.
verses.ct: Ahithophel told Absalom, "Have relations with your father's secondary wives, the ones he left behind to take care of the palace. When all Israel hears that you have made yourself repulsive to your father, everyone who supports you will be strengthened in their resolve."

verses.kjv: So they spread Absalom a tent upon the top of the house; and Absalom went in unto his father’s concubines in the sight of all Israel.
verses.ct: So they set up a tent for Absalom on the roof of the palace, and Absalom had relations with his father's secondary wives in plain view of all Israel.

verses.kjv: And the counsel of Ahithophel, which he counselled in those days, was as if a man had enquired at the oracle of God: so was all the counsel of Ahithophel both with David and with Absalom.
verses.ct: In those days, the advice Ahithophel gave was treated as though someone had consulted God directly. That's how both David and Absalom regarded every piece of counsel from Ahithophel.
